verses.devanagari:
ॐ ब्रह्मैवेदमिदं सर्वं न द्वितीयमस्ति किञ्चन।
हृदये पुण्डरीके नित्यं आस्ते भगवान् हरिः॥
verses.iast:
oṁ brahmaivedam idaṁ sarvaṁ na dvitīyam asti kiñcana.
hṛdaye puṇḍarīke nityaṁ āste bhagavān hariḥ.
verses.translation: The Absolute Truth alone pervades; there is no second. Within the lotus of the heart the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Hari, eternally sits.

verses.devanagari:
नवद्वारे पुरे देहे साक्षी वसति माधवः।
वासुदेव इति प्रोक्तो नाम्ना तं तरति जनः॥
verses.iast:
navadvāre pure dehe sākṣī vasati mādhavaḥ.
vāsudeva iti prokto nāmnā taṁ tarati janaḥ.
verses.translation: Within this nine-gated city of the body the witness, Mādhava, resides. Known as Vāsudeva, by His holy name one crosses beyond.

verses.devanagari:
पञ्चप्राणा उपासते तस्य दासाः सनातनाः।
मनश्च तस्य दूतोऽस्ति बुद्धिर्दीपः स्वयम्प्रभः॥
verses.iast:
pañcaprāṇā upāsate tasya dāsāḥ sanātanāḥ.
manaś ca tasya dūto'sti buddhir dīpaḥ svayaṁprabhaḥ.
verses.translation: The five prāṇas attend Him as eternal servants; the mind acts as His messenger, and intelligence, by His grace, becomes a lamp self-luminous.

verses.devanagari:
ओंकारो धनुरुच्येत मन्त्रः शर इव स्मृतः।
हृदि लक्ष्यं परं ब्रह्म प्रेम तस्य तन्तुरुच्यते॥
verses.iast:
oṁkāro dhanur ucyeta mantraḥ śara iva smṛtaḥ.
hṛdi lakṣyaṁ paraṁ brahma prema tasya tantur ucyate.
verses.translation: Oṁ is accepted as the bow, the mantra as an arrow. The target is the Supreme Brahman within the heart, and love is the string that launches it.

verses.devanagari:
गुरुरेव परं ब्रह्म दीपयति हृदि स्थिरम्।
सेवया प्रणिपातेन ज्ञानं भक्त्या च दृश्यते॥
verses.iast:
gurur eva paraṁ brahma dīpayati hṛdi sthiram.
sevayā praṇipātena jñānaṁ bhaktyā ca dṛśyate.
verses.translation: The bona fide spiritual master kindles the Supreme within the heart. Through service and humble surrender, knowledge, joined with devotion, becomes manifest.

verses.devanagari:
जाग्रत् स्वप्न सुषुप्तिरिति अवस्थास्तिस्रो मताः।
तुरीयो नारायणः शुद्धो विभाति निरुपाधिकः॥
verses.iast:
jāgrat svapna suṣuptir iti avasthās tisro matāḥ.
turīyo nārāyaṇaḥ śuddho vibhāti nirupādhikaḥ.
verses.translation: Waking, dream, and deep sleep are accepted as three states; the fourth, ever pure and designation-free, is Nārāyaṇa, who alone shines.

verses.devanagari:
नैवासङ्गो न संन्यासो भक्तिरेव परा गतिः।
कर्मणां फलसंन्यासात् हृदयग्रन्थिः प्रशीयते॥
verses.iast:
naivāsaṅgo na saṁnyāso bhaktir eva parā gatiḥ.
karmaṇāṁ phalasaṁnyāsāt hṛdayagranthiḥ praśīyate.
verses.translation: Neither attachment nor dry renunciation is the goal; devotion alone is the supreme way. By offering the fruits of work, the knot in the heart slackens.

verses.devanagari:
गोविन्द-नारायण-राम इति नामानि कीर्तयन्।
पापपङ्कात् विनिर्मुक्तो मनः शान्तिं निगच्छति॥
verses.iast:
govinda-nārāyaṇa-rāma iti nāmāni kīrtayan.
pāpapaṅkāt vinirmukto manaḥ śāntiṁ nigacchati.
verses.translation: Chanting the holy names—Govinda, Nārāyaṇa, Rāma—becomes free from the mire of sin; the mind at once attains peace.

verses.devanagari:
अणुरात्मा देहमध्ये चैतन्येन प्रकाशते।
देहाद् भिन्नो जीवात्मा भगवानं प्रपद्यते॥
verses.iast:
aṇur ātmā dehamadhye caitanyena prakāśate.
dehād bhinno jīvātmā bhagavānaṁ prapadyate.
verses.translation: The minute self shines within the body by consciousness. Distinct from the body, the jīva becomes liberated by surrendering to the Supreme Lord.

verses.devanagari:
निरभयः सदा भवति भक्त्या विष्णोः परायणः।
अमृतत्वं समासाद्य विष्णोः पदमवाप्नुयात्॥
verses.iast:
nirabhayaḥ sadā bhavati bhaktyā viṣṇoḥ parāyaṇaḥ.
amṛtatvaṁ samāsādya viṣṇoḥ padam avāpnuyāt.
verses.translation: One devoted to Lord Viṣṇu becomes fearless. Attaining immortality, he reaches the abode of Viṣṇu, the Supreme destination.

verses.devanagari:
देहे हृदि महोत्पन्नं पद्मं ज्ञानप्रकाशकम् ।
तत्रासीनः स्वयंज्योतिर्भगवान् परमेश्वरः ॥
verses.iast:
dehe hṛdi mahotpannaṁ padmaṁ jñānaprakāśakam |
tatrāsīnaḥ svayaṁjyotir bhagavān parameśvaraḥ ||
verses.translation: Within this body, in the lotus of the heart that shines with knowledge, the self-effulgent Lord, the Supreme Controller, is seated.

verses.devanagari:
ओङ्कारनादसंयुक्तैर्नामानि परमात्मनः ।
शृण्वन्नुच्चारयन्नित्यं चित्तशुद्धिमवाप्नुयात् ॥
verses.iast:
oṅkāranādasaṁyuktair nāmāni paramātmanaḥ |
śṛṇvan uccārayan nityaṁ cittaśuddhim avāpnuyāt ||
verses.translation: By constantly hearing and pronouncing the holy names of the Supreme Self, united with the sound of Om, one attains purity of mind.

verses.devanagari:
यथा भानुः शुचि तोये प्रतिबिम्बः प्रकाशते ।
तथा चित्ते परं ब्रह्म साक्षी तिष्ठति सर्वदा ॥
verses.iast:
yathā bhānuḥ śuci toye pratibimbaḥ prakāśate |
tathā citte paraṁ brahma sākṣī tiṣṭhati sarvadā ||
verses.translation: As the sun’s reflection appears in clear water, so the Supreme Brahman dwells as the witness within the purified mind, always.

verses.devanagari:
अविद्यामेघसंछन्नं न ज्ञातुं मनसा जनैः ।
भक्त्या तु विशुद्धचेतसा पश्यति हृदि केशवम् ॥
verses.iast:
avidyāmeghasaṁchannaṁ na jñātuṁ manasā janaiḥ |
bhaktyā tu viśuddhacetasā paśyati hṛdi keśavam ||
verses.translation: Veiled by the cloud of ignorance, He is not grasped by the mind of ordinary men; yet by devotion, with a purified heart, one beholds Keśava within.

verses.devanagari:
प्राणोऽयमुद्गतो नित्यं नाडीसु प्रवहत्यसौ ।
प्रणवस्मरणेनैव मार्गः स्याद्ब्रह्मणः परः ॥
verses.iast:
prāṇo'yam udgato nityaṁ nāḍīsu pravahaty asau |
praṇavasmaraṇenaiva mārgaḥ syād brahmaṇaḥ paraḥ ||
verses.translation: The life-air ever rises and flows through the channels; by remembrance of Om, the way to the Supreme Brahman becomes open.

verses.devanagari:
गुरोः कृपां विना नास्ति सिद्धिः साधनकोविदैः ।
मन्त्रबीजं हृदि न्यस्य भक्तिः प्रसरति ध्रुवम् ॥
verses.iast:
guroḥ kṛpāṁ vinā nāsti siddhiḥ sādhanakovidaiḥ |
mantrabījaṁ hṛdi nyasya bhaktiḥ prasarati dhruvam ||
verses.translation: Without the mercy of the spiritual master there is no real attainment; placing the mantra-seed in the heart, devotion steadily expands.

verses.devanagari:
सत्त्वं रजस्तमश्चैव बध्नन्ति हृदि मानवम् ।
भक्तिनौकां समारुह्य तरिष्यति महार्णवम् ॥
verses.iast:
sattvaṁ rajas tamaś caiva badhnanti hṛdi mānavam |
bhaktinaukāṁ samāruhya tariṣyati mahārṇavam ||
verses.translation: Goodness, passion and darkness bind the man within the heart; but boarding the boat of devotion, he crosses the vast ocean.

verses.devanagari:
यत्कर्म कृतमद्यैतत् तत्त्ववेत्ता समर्पयेत् ।
नारायणाय हृदि तत् त्यागो वैराग्यकारणम् ॥
verses.iast:
yat karma kṛtam adyaitat tattvavettā samarpayet |
nārāyaṇāya hṛdi tat tyāgo vairāgyakāraṇam ||
verses.translation: Whatever work is done today, the knower of truth should offer it to Nārāyaṇa within the heart; such dedication is the cause of real detachment.

verses.devanagari:
भक्त्या ज्ञानविरागाभ्यां हृदयग्रन्थिरुच्छिद्यते ।
निवर्तते भवोऽस्माकं प्रकाशते परं पदम् ॥
verses.iast:
bhaktyā jñānavirāgābhyāṁ hṛdayagranthir ucchidyate |
nivartate bhavo'smākaṁ prakāśate paraṁ padam ||
verses.translation: By devotion, together with knowledge and detachment, the knot of the heart is cut; material bondage ceases, and the supreme abode shines forth.

verses.devanagari:
स्मरन्नारायणं देवं प्राणो ब्रह्मरन्ध्रतः ।
निर्गच्छन् परमं धाम प्राप्नोति न निवर्तते ॥
verses.iast:
smaran nārāyaṇaṁ devaṁ prāṇo brahmarandhrataḥ |
nirgacchan paramaṁ dhāma prāpnoti na nivartate ||
verses.translation: Remembering Nārāyaṇa, the Lord, when the life-air departs from the crown, one attains the supreme abode and does not return.

verses.devanagari:
देहे हृदि हृदयाकाशे नित्यो नारायणः प्रभुः ।
ओङ्काररूपो भगवान् प्राणधारो जनार्दनः ॥
verses.iast:
dehe hṛdi hṛdayākāśe nityo nārāyaṇaḥ prabhuḥ |
oṅkārarūpo bhagavān prāṇadhāro janārdanaḥ ||

word_by_word.english: in the sky of the heart

verses.translation: Within the body, in the heart’s sky, the eternal Lord Nārāyaṇa resides. He is Bhagavān, the Oṁ-personified, the maintainer of all prāṇas, Janārdana.

verses.devanagari:
न दण्डैर्न तपोभिर्न नानाव्रतकर्मणा ।
भक्त्या तु दृश्यते देवो हृदि सुप्रसन्नचेतसा ॥
verses.iast:
na daṇḍair na tapobhir na nānāvratakarmaṇā |
bhaktyā tu dṛśyate devo hṛdi suprasannacetasā ||
verses.translation: Not by rules, nor by sheer austerity, nor by manifold vows and rituals—by devotion alone the Lord is seen, within the heart, when the mind becomes truly pleased.

verses.devanagari:
तस्माद् गुरौ समाश्रित्य विद्या प्रसरति ध्रुवम् ।
येनान्धकारो हृदयात् क्षणेन निलीयते ॥
verses.iast:
tasmād gurau samāśritya vidyā prasarati dhruvam |
yenāndhakāro hṛdayāt kṣaṇena nilīyate ||
verses.translation: Therefore one should take firm shelter of the spiritual master; then true knowledge expands, and the heart’s darkness dissolves in a moment.

verses.devanagari:
नामामृतं पिबेद्भक्तो नारायणकथाश्रयः ।
तरेत मोहसामुद्रं नौभिर्वेदपुरस्कृतः ॥
verses.iast:
nāmāmṛtaṁ pibed bhakto nārāyaṇakathāśrayaḥ |
tareta mohasāmudraṁ naubhir vedapuraskṛtaḥ ||

word_by_word.english: taking shelter of narrations of Nārāyaṇa

verses.translation: Let the devotee drink the nectar of the holy name, dwelling within the stories of Nārāyaṇa; thus he crosses the ocean of illusion, guided by the Vedas as his boats.

verses.devanagari:
साक्षी चैकः परो देवो भुक्ते भोक्तरि तिष्ठति ।
असङ्गो ह्यन्तरात्मा स सर्वान् नियति ध्रुवम् ॥
verses.iast:
sākṣī caikaḥ paro devo bhukte bhoktari tiṣṭhati |
asaṅgo hy antarātmā sa sarvān niyati dhruvam ||
verses.translation: One Supreme Lord stands as witness—within enjoyment and the enjoyer. Though unattached, He is the Inner Self; surely He governs all.

verses.devanagari:
मानदर्पं च लोभं च देहेन्द्रियनियोजितम् ।
हृत्वा हृत्वा हरौ बुद्धिं दत्त्वा शान्तिमवाप्नुयात् ॥
verses.iast:
mānadarpaṁ ca lobhaṁ ca dehendriyaniyojitam |
hṛtvā hṛtvā harau buddhiṁ dattvā śāntim avāpnuyāt ||
verses.translation: Severing, again and again, the pride and greed tied to body and senses, and offering the intelligence to Hari, one attains peace.

verses.devanagari:
यो विसृज्य विभेदांश्च पश्येद् विश्वं जनार्दने ।
तं न हन्त्यपि कालोऽपि तस्मिन् सन्निहितो धिया ॥
verses.iast:
yo visṛjya vibhedāṁś ca paśyed viśvaṁ janārdane |
taṁ na hanty api kālo'pi tasmin sannihito dhiyā ||
verses.translation: He who, giving up the sense of division, beholds the whole cosmos in Janārdana—him even time cannot strike, for his understanding abides in Him.

verses.devanagari:
न शून्यतैव मोक्षः स्याद् अनुभवस्य विरुद्धता ।
सेवैव परमा मुक्तिर्नित्यदास्यं मनीषिभिः ॥
verses.iast:
na śūnyataiva mokṣaḥ syād anubhavasya viruddhatā |
sevaiva paramā muktir nityadāsyaṁ manīṣibhiḥ ||
verses.translation: Liberation is not mere voidness—that would oppose true realization. Service alone is the supreme freedom; the wise know eternal servitorship.

verses.devanagari:
ओं नमो नारायणायेत्येतन्मन्त्रं सुदुर्लभम् ।
जपन्नहर्निशं भक्तो मुक्तिद्वारमवाप्नुयात् ॥
verses.iast:
oṁ namo nārāyaṇāyety etan mantraṁ sudurlabham |
japann aharniśaṁ bhaktaḥ muktidvāram avāpnuyāt ||
verses.translation: By chanting day and night this very rare mantra—‘oṁ namo nārāyaṇāya’—the devotee approaches the gate of liberation.

verses.devanagari:
एते गुह्यतमाः श्लोकाः ब्रह्मणे परमात्मने ।
यः पठेद् शृणुयाद्वापि तस्यान्ते विष्णोः पदगतिः ॥
verses.iast:
ete guhyatamāḥ ślokā brahmaṇe paramātmane |
yaḥ paṭhed śṛṇuyād vāpi tasyānte viṣṇoḥ padagatiḥ ||
verses.translation: These verses, most confidential, glorify Brahman, the Supreme Self. Whoever reads or hears them, at life’s end attains the abode of Viṣṇu.

verses.devanagari:
हृदयकमले नित्यं नारायण एव स्थितः ।
अणोरणीयान् महतो महीयान् भक्तितोषितः ॥
verses.iast:
hṛdaya-kamale nityaṁ nārāyaṇa eva sthitaḥ |
aṇor aṇīyān mahato mahīyān bhakti-toṣitaḥ ||

word_by_word.english: in the lotus of the heart

verses.translation: Within the lotus of the heart the Supreme Lord, Nārāyaṇa, is ever situated—smaller than the smallest, greater than the greatest, and He is satisfied by devotion.

verses.devanagari:
प्रणवः साधनं प्रोक्तो जीवः शर इवोद्धृतः ।
ब्रह्मण्यवस्थितः साक्षात् न पुनर्भ्रमति ध्रुवम् ॥
verses.iast:
praṇavaḥ sādhanam proktaḥ jīvaḥ śara ivoddhṛtaḥ |
brahmaṇy avasthitaḥ sākṣāt na punar bhramati dhruvam ||
verses.translation: Om is taught as the means; the living self, like an arrow set and drawn, when fixed in Brahman directly, surely does not wander again.

verses.devanagari:
शिखा चोपवितं त्यक्त्वा यतिर्धर्मपरायणः ।
विद्या शिखा भवेत् तस्य तपोऽस्योपवितं भवेत् ॥
verses.iast:
śikhā copavitaṁ tyaktvā yatir dharma-parāyaṇaḥ |
vidyā śikhā bhavet tasya tapo'syopavitaṁ bhavet ||
verses.translation: Casting off topknot and sacred thread, the saint devoted to the real duty accepts knowledge as his crest, and austerity as his thread.

verses.devanagari:
अहिंसा दण्ड इत्युक्तः शमः काषायवासनम् ।
सत्यं भिक्षापात्रं स्याद्दया कमण्डलुर्भवेत् ॥
verses.iast:
ahiṁsā daṇḍa ity uktaḥ śamaḥ kāṣāya-vāsanam |
satyaṁ bhikṣā-pātraṁ syād dayā kamaṇḍalur bhavet ||
verses.translation: Nonviolence is his staff, tranquility his ochre robe; truth serves as his bowl, and compassion becomes his waterpot.

verses.devanagari:
इन्द्रियाणि निगृह्णीयाद् धृत्या धैर्येण नित्यदा ।
सर्वभूतेषु चैकात्म्यं पश्येत् ईश्वरतत्त्वतः ॥
verses.iast:
indriyāṇi nigṛhṇīyād dhṛtyā dhairyeṇa nityadā |
sarva-bhūteṣu caikātmyaṁ paśyet īśvara-tattvataḥ ||

word_by_word.english: from the standpoint of the Lord's truth

verses.translation: Steady and brave, he should restrain the senses at all times, and behold the single Self in all beings, in light of the Lord's truth.

verses.devanagari:
गुरुमुपास्य विनयात् तस्माद् वेदविदां वरात् ।
प्रणवात्मकं मन्त्रेण ब्रह्म ध्यायेत् निरन्तरम् ॥
verses.iast:
gurum upāsya vinayāt tasmād veda-vidāṁ varāt |
praṇavātmakaṁ mantreṇa brahma dhyāyet nirantaram ||
verses.translation: Having approached the spiritual master with humility, the best of Veda-knowers, one should, by the mantra of Om, meditate upon Brahman without break.

verses.devanagari:
एष देहो मलाकीर्णः क्षणिको दुःखसञ्चयः ।
ज्ञानाग्निना देहाभिमानं दग्ध्वा ब्रह्मणि तिष्ठति ॥
verses.iast:
eṣa deho malākīrṇaḥ kṣaṇiko duḥkha-saṁcayaḥ |
jñānāgninā dehābhimānaṁ dagdhvā brahmaṇi tiṣṭhati ||
verses.translation: This body is filthy, fleeting, a stockpile of misery. Burning the bodily notion in the fire of knowledge, one stands established in Brahman.

verses.devanagari:
ब्रह्म जानाति ब्राह्मणो न जातिमात्रलक्षणः ।
यो वेत्ति परमं तत्त्वं स एव ब्राह्मणो मुनिः ॥
verses.iast:
brahma jānāti brāhmaṇo na jāti-mātra-lakṣaṇaḥ |
yo vetti paramaṁ tattvaṁ sa eva brāhmaṇo muniḥ ||
verses.translation: A true Brāhmaṇa is the knower of Brahman, not one marked only by birth. He who knows the supreme truth—he alone is the Brāhmaṇa, the sage.

verses.devanagari:
न वेदानवमान्येत न कर्म द्वेष्यतां नयेत् ।
सारं गृह्ण्यात् समालोक्य फलहेतुं परित्यजेत् ॥
verses.iast:
na vedān avamānyeta na karma dveṣyatāṁ nayet |
sāraṁ gṛhṇyāt samālokya phala-hetuṁ parityajet ||
verses.translation: Let one not slight the Vedas nor bring works into disdain. Perceiving their essence, he accepts that, and gives up the motive for fruit.

verses.devanagari:
एषा ब्रह्मविद्या गुह्या गुह्यतरपरिगोपिता ।
शुश्रूषवे विनीताय भक्तायैव प्रदीयताम् ॥
verses.iast:
eṣā brahma-vidyā guhyā guhya-tara-parigopitā |
śuśrūṣave vinītāya bhaktāyaiva pradīyatām ||
verses.translation: This Brahma-vidyā is secret, carefully guarded as most confidential; let it be imparted only to one who is submissive, eager to hear, and devoted.
